info.name: COINMETRO API (PUBLIC)
info.description:
Intro

CoinMetro REST API allows to programmatically operate on the CoinMetro Crypto Exchange.

Authentication is managed with JWT Authorization Bearer tokens. The collection supports some degree of automation, loading said token as environment variable. Please run in POSTman, within an environment (2 preloaded environments are provided).

Data formats

Requests are accepted in JSON (preferred) or url-encoded format. Responses are always JSON.

Environments

VERY IMPORTANT PLEASE READ BELOW

There are two distinct environments:

  • A LIVE environment @ https://api.coinmetro.com
  • A DEMO enviroment @ https://api.coinmetro.com/open

All requests starting with https://api.coinmetro.com/open will be routed to the demo environment.

If you want to trade your real account, make sure you're not using https://api.coinmetro.com/open.

Use https://api.coinmetro.com (without /open) to interact with your real account.

180 seconds tour

Load in POSTman with one of the provided environments for quickest setup and smoothest operation.

Generate Demo Access
Get your Balances
Get you Wallet Histories
Check the Latest Prices
Download the Historical Data
Get the Book
Send an Order
Check your Fills
Check your Order History
Get your updated Balances
Get your updated Wallet Histories

Additional Documentation, Demos and Examples

Please see https://github.com/CoinMetro/API-DOCS for additional info about the API, WebSockets, and some working examples.

IMPORTANT: For all further queries and clarifications about the API, to signal what you believe might be an error or an unclear part of the documentation, please contact us through Intercom: https://help.coinmetro.com/en/

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
This path is used to obtain a demo token, it is only active on the https://api.coinmetro.com/open open API.

The demo tokens have unilimited lifetime.

header.description: In case of 2FA, the OTP code shall be sent in this field

request.description:
Obtains session. All subsequent API calls are sent with the token, allowing to authenticate and identify a user.

In the LIVE environment, the tokens expire after 30 minutes of inactivity, and are bound to a single IP. To obtain non-expiring tokens that are not IP-bound please use the "Long lived tokens" paths.

In the DEMO environment, the tokens are valid forever and can be used on multiple IPs.

In case 2FA is enabled and no TOTP code is provided, a 202 code will be returned.

This endpoint is protected by grecaptcha, a valid g-recaptcha-response parameter is required in body. Temporarily, this limitation can be avoided by using X-Device-Id: bypass header

header.description: In case of 2FA, the OTP code shall be sent in this field

request.description: Revoke authentication token.

item.name: Long lived tokens

header.description: In case of 2FA, the OTP code shall be sent in this field

request.description:
Obtains long lived sessions for mobile devices. All subsequent API calls are sent with the token, allowing to authenticate and identify a user.

Multiple of such sessions may exist at one time. The devices must be authorized through web interface.

All subsequent API calls using the long-lived tokens shall include the X-Device-ID field with the same X-Device-ID that was used to obtain the token.

In case the device is not enabled, will return message: "New Device" in the response fields and the token will not be active until enabled through Web UI.

In case 2FA is enabled and no TOTP code is provided, a 202 code will be returned.

header.description: In case of 2FA, the OTP code shall be sent in this field

request.description: Provides information about a yet-to-be authorized mobile device

urlencoded.description: Token obtained through previous call to /jwtDevice

item.name: Create Long Lived Read Only Token

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

request.description:
Requests a read-only long-lived token.

This endpoint requires authentication.

The long-lived token will be created instantly, with prefilled values for deviceId, PIN and deviceName, which will be communicated back to the user.

The token is used as a normal device token, but will only be able to execute GET requests against CoinMetro's authenticated endpoints.

The token can be monitored and revoked in the account settings page on Web.

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

item.description:
These paths allow to generate long lived tokens that don't expire after 30 minutes of inactivity, for API usage.

These paths are not active on the /open/ api

The usage pattern is as follows:

  1. The client generates an unique Device Id and stores it, it will be sent with each request in the X-Device-ID header

  2. Login is requested with X-Device-ID header, an access Bearer Token (non-active) is received.

  3. Info for the device is provided with the Provide device info path, also requested with the X-Device-ID header and the token received in step (1).

  4. An email is received for the authorization of the device

  5. Device is authorized from the UI @ https://go.coinmetro.com/settings. The same UI also provides tools to force logout and delete devices.

  6. All subsequent requests include the Bearer Token received in step (1) and the X-Device-Id generated in step (0)

These paths allow to obtain tokens for interaction with the rest of the API.

Tokens obtained on the demo platform (https://api.coinmetro.com/open) always have unlimited lifetime, whether they are obtained by using the demo token path or the standard login path.

Tokens obtained on the production platform (https://api.coinmetro.com/) can be of two types:

  1. Standard tokens obtained with the Login path are short lived tokens, they expire after 30 minutes of inactivity. Only private user API calls (not public data paths) are counted as activity to this end.

  2. Long lived tokens obtained with the Long lived tokens paths last forever and can be revoked from the UI.

request.description: Gets latest balances and their equivalent in EUR and BTC

Retrieves the wallets of a given user.

Does NOT return the transaction list, use GET WALLET HISTORIES below for that.

For every wallet, returns balance as well as the reserved amount.

request.description:
Sends an order to the exchange

One (and only one) ofbuyingQtyor sellingQty is required for market orders, both for limit orders.

For limit orders, by default, the order is considered filled when either buyingQty or sellingQty is filled. Use the fillStyle property to change this behaviour.

request.description:
Modifies a pending order or an open position.

You can't modify sellingQty or buyingQty for an order that entered partially.

If you modify only one of sellingQty or buyingQty, the system will interpret that as changing the overall quantity of the order while keeping the same price. To change the price, you'll have to change both buyingQty and sellingQty at the same time.

You can't modify userData[takeProfit] or userData[stopLoss] for a position the closed partially.
Cancels the remainder of an open order.

Requests a swap to the exchange.

One (and only one) ofbuyingQtyor sellingQty is required.

The swap must be confirmed using the Confirm Swap endpoint. It is valid for 30 seconds.

Possible errors:

422 - "Both buyingCurrency and sellingCurrency are required"

422 - "One and only one of buyingQty and sellingQty is required"

422 - "Invalid buyingCurrency"

422 - "Invalid sellingCurrency"

422 - "Invalid buyingQty"

422 - "Invalid sellingQty"

422 - "Insufficient balance"

500 - Unknown Error

Confirms a swap previously requested.

Must indicate swapId, the id from the object previously obtained through Request Swap

Possible errors:

400 - "swapId is required"

404 - "Invalid swapId"

422 - "Swap expired"

422 - "Swap already executed"

422 - "Insufficient balance"

500 - "Excessive rate variation"

500 - "Unexpected swap status"

500 - Unknown Error

item.name: Margin Trading

urlencoded.description: The amount of EUR to be posted as collateral
The amount of BTC to be posted as collateral

request.description:
This request supports an object with currencies as keys and amounts as values.

For each currency (key), a corresponding amount (value) of the balance of the wallet will be set as reserve for margin trading.

The request is idempotent.

Supported currencies (keys) at time of writing are EUR, USD, GBP, BTC, LTC, ETH, BCH, XRP, for a maximum value of 10000EUR posted as collateral.

If there's already some margin trading activity, the request will be rejected if the new amounts are not sufficient to cover exposure.

urlencoded.description: The amount of EUR to be posted as collateral
The amount of BTC to be posted as collateral

description.content: The currency to be used to settle margin P/L (must already have posted collateral)

variable.description: The currency to be used to settle margin P/L (must already have posted collateral)

urlencoded.description: Fraction of order to close, between 0 and 1 (optional, defaults to 1)
Fraction of order to close, between 0 and 1 (optional, defaults to 1)
orderID of the orders to close. At least 1, at most 10
orderID of the orders to close. At least 1, at most 10
orderID of the orders to close. At least 1, at most 10
Boolean, close the remainder of the orders after hedging if set

request.description:
Hedges opposite orders and pays out PLs.

In case the orders are not exactly identical in size, the smaller side is closed out completely and the remainder of the partially closed orders is left standing.

All orders must be completely filled (`completionTime` must be set on the orderStatus entity).

At least one buy side order and one sell side order is required for each call.

At least two and at most ten orders can be hedged in a single call. The orders are closed out starting from the smallest (in terms of open size).

Example JSON body

{
  "orderIDs": [
    "5a3c24da33a3526f5f6e69cb16202996648001905b41bb6437a63", 
    "5a3c24da33a3526f5f6e69cb16202996648001905b41bb6437a66",
    "5a3c24da33a3526f5f6e69cb16202996648001905b41bb6437a67"
  ],
  "close": false
}

response.name: Hedge Orders

urlencoded.description: orderID of the orders to close. At least 1, at most 10
orderID of the orders to close. At least 1, at most 10
orderID of the orders to close. At least 1, at most 10
Boolean, close the remainder of the orders after hedging (default: false)

item.description:
Margin Trading uses mostly the same functions as regular trading, but with some additions.

To start Margin Trading, a user has to post collateral.

Once a Margin Trading order is filled, it creates a Position that accumulates Open P/L.

When a position is Closed, the P/L is also closed and paid to the users wallets. The P/L is always paid in one of the currencies that are being used as collateral, the preferred settlement currency can be chosen.

The orders can be closed partially, and also support Take Profit and Stop Loss functionality.

The status of the Position is tracked within the Order object, with additional properties

closedQty => The amount that has been closed, for the base currency
closedTime => If an order is closed, the timestamp of the final close
settledQty => An array with currencies as keys and amounts as values, the actual values of settled closed P/L expressed in units of the collateral
closedVal => The amount that has been closed, for the quote currency

variable.description: Timestamp of first candle in milliseconds (optional)
Timestamp of last candle in milliseconds (optional)

request.description:
Lists latest prices for all traded pairs.

Also includes info about 24h volumes and ranges.
Lists latest trades (ticks) for the selected pair.

variable.description: Timestamp of first tick in milliseconds (optional)

request.description: List of all Traded Assets, ordered by listing date. Includes precision and minimum traded quantity for each asset.

request.description: List of all active Markets, indicates trading precision and whether pair is available for margin trading.

response.name: Trading Markets

request.description: Full book for the selected pair

Recent book updates for the selected pair

The from field is compulsory on this one, can be set to 0 to retrieve the maximum range (100 updates).

Every update included a CRC32 checksum of the book so that it can be verified that the client and the server are in sync.

Some considerations apply for the correct calculation of the checksum, please see https://github.com/CoinMetro/API-DOCS#book-update-message for further info.

description.content: Sequence number from which to start the updates, non inclusive.

variable.description: Sequence number from which to start the updates, non inclusive.
